alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 12:49PM MST until January 03 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch and total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches; higher snowfall amounts are possible and winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...From 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ this evening to 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Tuesday. Best chances for ice accumulation will be late tonight through the day on Monday. Best chances for accumulating snow will be Monday night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slick and difficult road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Power outages and tree damage are possible from ice accumulation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snowfall will cover any ice accumulations on sidewalks and roadways. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on the wintry precipitation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. &&
